channel.title: Portforwarding help
channel.description:
Hey,
All the tutorials i see make it look all SO Easy. Because they are using easy to use routers.
Can someone please tell me how to do it using a "dynalink" router.
It asked for:
User defined: Runescape Come from IP: ALL Forward to IP address (WHAT DO I PUT HERE) By using these Rules -
By using the rules: Protocol External Packet Forward to Internal Host Port Start Port End Port TCPUDPTCP/UDP TCPUDPTCP/UDP TCPUDPTCP/UDP
^^ But it has that in like a TABLE and it asked for a start and end port for both - external packet and forward host!! what do i type in for all this???????//

item.title: Portforwarding help
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Forward to IP address - Your IPv4 Address
Start and End port = 43594 or your server port
Protocol is TCP
What else do you need?

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding help
item.dc:creator: @MobilScape MobilScape
item.description:
@MobilScape wrote:

Hey,

All the tutorials i see make it look all SO Easy. Because they are using easy to use routers.

Can someone please tell me how to do it using a “dynalink” router.

It asked for:

User defined: Runescape
Come from IP: ALL
Forward to IP address (WHAT DO I PUT HERE)
By using these Rules -

By using the rules:
Protocol External Packet Forward to Internal Host
Port Start
Port End Port
TCPUDPTCP/UDP
TCPUDPTCP/UDP
TCPUDPTCP/UDP

^^ But it has that in like a TABLE and it asked for a start and end port for both - external packet and forward host!!
what do i type in for all this???//

Read full topic
